meanings.definition: To abandon one's allegiance or duty
meanings.sent1: He decided to redefect from his team and join the opponents.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to redefect from her country, so she stayed loyal.
meanings.sent3: The spy's plan to redefect backfired when he was caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: The student's choice to redefect to a different school was a shock to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's decision to redefect in the middle of battle caused chaos.

meanings.definition: To betray or desert a cause or organization
meanings.sent1: The agent was planning to redefect to the enemy's side.
meanings.sent2: It is not honorable to redefect from your friends when they need you.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to redefect to the neighbor's house was thwarted by a closed door.
meanings.sent4: The politician's choice to redefect to a rival party shocked his supporters.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's decision to redefect to a different team caused a stir in the sports world.

meanings.definition: To renounce or break a promise
meanings.sent1: She had to redefect her commitment to attend the event due to an emergency.
meanings.sent2: It is never right to redefect a vow made to a loved one.
meanings.sent3: The magician's rabbit tried to redefect its disappearing act but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The company's decision to redefect their guarantee led to customer dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent5: The artist's choice to redefect their promise of a new painting disappointed their fans.
